content: ©the secret craft book mini-mals monkey pattern us terminology by the secret cra� book the pattern and images in this document are property of the secret cra� book distribution of this pattern in whole or part is not allowed you may sell finished items you make from this pattern but please credit me @thesecretcra�bookpatterns i d love to see your finished items please tag me on instagram and use the hashtag #thesecretcra�book and #mini_mals for any help with this pattern you can contact me at thesecretcra�book@gmail com thank you for your support ©the secret craft book materials 2 75mm hook dk acrylic or cotton yarn in 2 colours - light brown - beige 1 stitch marker black embroidery thread for eyes tapestry needle fiber-fill stuffing abbreviations chain = chain st = stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase two single crochets in to one stitch decrease = decrease single_crochet two stitches together fo = fasten_off rs= right side unless stated otherwise this pattern is crochetedin a continuous round use a stitch marker to mark the beginning of the round pattern body and head note r1 starts at the bottom of the body and r18 is the top of the head r1 with brown working into a magic_ring 6 single_crochet 6 sts r2 increase 6 times 12 sts r3 1 single_crochet increase 6 times 18 sts r4-6 single_crochet around 18 sts r7 1 single_crochet decrease 6 times 12 sts start stuffing the body continue stuffing as you go r8 decrease 6 times 6 sts r9 single_crochet around 6 sts r10 increase 6 times 12 sts ©the secret craft book r11 1 single_crochet increase 6 times 18 sts r12 2 single_crochet increase 6 times 24 sts r13-15 single_crochet around 24 sts r16 2 single_crochet decrease 6 times 18 sts start stuffing the head continue stuffing as you go r17 1 single_crochet decrease 6 times 12 sts r18 decrease 6 times 6 sts fo leaving a long tail face r1 with beige working into a magic_ring 6 single_crochet 6 sts r2 increase 6 times 12 sts r3 1 single_crochet increase 6 times 18 sts muzzle r1 chain 6 r2 starting in second chain from hook 4 single_crochet then in last st - 3 single_crochet rotating as you go working in the other side of the chain 3 single_crochet in last chain - 2 single_crochet 12 sts r3 single_crochet around 12 sts fo leaving a long tail for sewing inner ear make 2 r1 with beige working into a magic_ring 6 single_crochet slip_stitch in to first st 6 sts fo and weave in ends outer ear make 2 r1 with brown working into a magic_ring 6 single_crochet 6 sts do not fo now you will join the inner and outer ear together crocheting through both ear pieces at once hold the inner and outer ear pieces together ensuring the rs of each ear piece is facing outwards continue in brown and crochet round 2 through both ear pieces as shown below
